@kelsea112 @asianewzealand only just managed to get pic off camera, sorry! Meat choc was v edible.
Student on cable car complaining about the tourists on it and 30 secs late talking about his upcoming travel to SE Asia.
Adam Liaw: the only place you'll find "teriyaki chicken" in Japan is likely to be McDonald's.
apparently how to cook rice is the most searched-for recipe internationally.
Rice cooking lesson from Adam Liaw and Wgtn's Tatsushi Mikuni https://t.co/QoKDFdF1V0
& now I'd better return it to @wcl_library as it's somewhat overdue.
Just finished this excellent book. Do try and see @samanth_s at @AklWritersFest https://t.co/aKYEQWeasJ

Forgot to type a sign before I went to #AKL airport to meet #Lantern Festival performers. Just me & my felts. https://t.co/I9iz1a1OIR
Went for an evening walk to post our #nzflag voting papers & discovered our neighbourhood post box no longer exists. Democracy in action.
@kat_m_williams better pic than mine!
Things to be excited about: The Assassin http://t.co/wOGr6QYVtC & Our Little Sister http://t.co/MERkiHk25d Hooray for @nzff.
Worth coming to #Akl just to watch allergic daughter eat decadent vegan cakes (Janken on Jervois Rd) http://t.co/TCHeohRSer
Also great to meet @antondiaz @DaphneOP @Philbizwatcher others #nzasean40
Short but sweet catch-up with @cesdrilon and Amy Pamintuan, lovely ladies & formidable journos #nzasean40 http://t.co/NrrgWO1KGP
Great to meet the #NZAsean40 journalist delegation. Never been asked so many questions about NZ's sheep population. http://t.co/eRH5n8Idiq
@cesdrilon Very nice! Look forward to catching up... turns out I'll be seeing you - and the others - on Friday morning.
@Nikki_Macdonald congratulations you! Well-deserved.
@Nikki_Macdonald no, but he did joke about that. I think Koichi felt an added connection.
@Nikki_Macdonald Going with a 5yo wasn't ideal, but still enjoyed it. M enjoyed learning his favourite foods are donuts and tofu. #awf15
Can't see any other kids so we must have the youngest audience member for Murakami at #AWF2015 #no babysitter http://t.co/ABtQa8hUGI
Much hypothetical discussion at home about which Murakami book we would, if we could get signed at #AWF15. My pick: http://t.co/02HuHx1i9J
@kjrothwell are you going to bed down in the cbd tonight? I should have stayed and had a drink with you!
Such a sweet story http://t.co/0q1sJXm5aL
@anzf_leadership I am amazed how @rikkym has managed to write such a rounded narrative in a notebook. With a pen.
@RKPriestley I rely on the turn of the road but sometimes not concentrating and I get it completely wrong.
Even if technically autumn.
The world outside the bus is completely black and I have no idea where my stop is. Officially winter.
Big thanks to @cdlanderson @JoyReidTVNZ &@ndbrennan for insightful panel on covering South Asia at @asianewzealand's #asianzhui today.
Learning a tonne of things I never knew about NZ-India relations from listening to #Chch's Don Rae at #asiaNZhui
First task of the day - sorting out 50 stage passes and tshirts for international performers at #akllanternfestival http://t.co/GHXZyXcJLL
You can also buy worm juice in #Waikouaiti (I didn't). http://t.co/8qE3lxqHXT
#Waikouaiti apparently has many claims to fame in #nz history. Who knew? http://t.co/hEtX0nm2cm
Fellow supermarket customer spent five minutes arguing with checkout guy about why she doesn't get Fly Buy points for buying cigarettes.
Hello ghost town #wgtn! I'm the only one on my bus home! Great time to go Christmas shopping in the CBD if anyone is still around...
The bus driver's hat is playing Christmas carols and has twinkling lights.
@GrowFromHereNZ I'm willing to send you this one as a Christmas present. Appears to have Billy Joel on the other side!
Turns out the pre-loved kitchen cabinet I bought has a secret compartment. Hope they're not missing Meatloaf tape. http://t.co/dugxusV6Wf
Evening walk. So still, cold and otherwise quiet you can pinpoint the location of all tui in my neighbourhood calling to each other.
Keep getting reminders on my phone for flights I'm no longer able to take, from places I'm not in. Feels like living an alternate reality.
Thanks to the very kind @FlyAirNZ staff member at #chch airport who helped me make my flight in the nick of time. Good to be home.
And now on air at Plains FM @cesdrilon http://t.co/gAboAFcQ0x
A few hours off the plane & already @cesdrilon is in midst of 1st meeting of the Assn of Filipino Tradesmen of NZ http://t.co/ZYh1iEeEtz
@cesdrilon compared to the Philippines, no. But at least it's not raining. Tomorrow looks really nice in Christchurch. See you soon!
Looking forward to welcoming @cesdrilon to New Zealand today! And the weather's looking nice in #chch the next couple of days.
& a history of NZ-China relations http://t.co/iBRKUCTyfC

@UnitecNZ not just accepting migrants as NZers, sometimes there's a failure to recognise 5th or 6th generation if of Asian heritage!
@DeSouzaRN summing up wide-ranging discussion at #EthnicMediaForum. How can we increase interaction between "ethnic" and "mainstream"?
Naoe Hashimoto doing a great job conveying the media needs of "small minority groups" in NZ at #EthnicMediaForum http://t.co/NZRCECAoz0
Another nifty thing I've learnt about at #EthnicMediaForum http://t.co/WGEPIkLVi4 @UnitecNZ
@deetalk Thanks, good to know. It's nice though that TV viewers can chance upon this content while channel-flicking. need to retune my TV!
My discovery of the morning: we now have a 24-hour free-to-air Indian TV station, Apna, in NZ. A welcome addition to channel flicking!
Impressive line-up of NZ "ethnic media" publications here at @UnitecNZ http://t.co/t7U8Ovw0jX
At @UnitecNZ hearing Niche Media survey about ethnic media in NZï¼šâ€œWhen given the choice, the ethnic option will always be taken."

Getting sneak preview of #Dreamliner alongside Chinese media ahead of flight to Shanghai @flyairnz http://t.co/4FyrYD6qB5
Shanghai, it's been too long (7 years). Looking forward to "dreamlining" to you overnight. Thanks @FlyAirNZ!
Loved Mickey's Christmas Carol as a kid so enchanted by @nzballet's #christmascarolstory (but may still have a soft spot for Scrooge McDuck)
@anzf_leadership Come on, show us a pic. Prove it!
@anzf_leadership Ok, tell us, who is at table 9? I reckon table 26 is pretty glam #asianz20
Feeling set for long weekend now that I've discovered the excellent Guy Delisle http://t.co/v2yuiV2QjU
@amoalife Sadly, no. We ladies lead a life of leisure, after all.
Remark from a father as I dropped my daughter at school: "Now you'll have to decide what to do with yourself for the day."
@lukeappleby @whatmattersnz Nice project. Will share it with my colleagues.
Almighty bang and a flicker of lights turned out to be a very large tree downed in the #wgtn wind, now blocking our street.
Gorgeous day here in #chch. I'm on the bus, listening to Talking Heads playing on its stereo and watching kids skateboarding outside.
Dress-up-as-favourite-#worldcup-team day at daycare. Daughter wanted to dress as a fairy so ended up with this. http://t.co/f2dV5lkVrz
"To rely on raw MT output is almost as bad an idea as getting a full-body tattoo in a language you donâ€™t speak", http://t.co/1rFm3SR4BH
@amoalife Meanwhile, how is your Dunedin food adventure going? No 7 Balmac, I tell you.
@amoalife "onsen tamago" also on menu (I didn't try). Don't know where secret #wgtn onsen is. Regardless, I love #tatsushi's seasonal food.
@amoalife hard to say exactly but fresh tofu, persimmon chunks and other mysterious ingredients that made for a yummy package.
Above average takeaways at Friday night Japanese class, c/o Tatsushi. http://t.co/b6UbQ5clbL
